election_record.label: New York 1822 Lieutenant Governor

overview.note: In the 1822 election, the Ballston Spa Gazette (Ballston Spa, NY) used the name 'Freeman's Meeting Ticket' to denote the Clintonian/Federalist.

sub_unit.name: Six
sub_unit.note: "For Governor, Lieutenant Governor, and Senators there were thirteen scattering votes." National Advocate (New York, NY). November 15, 1822.

sub_unit.name: Dutchess
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY) December 10, 1822 under the scattering votes from Dutchess County for Lt. Governor is one vote for Simpson Sleight. This vote was not reported in the Official County Return, but was in the State Wide Canvass.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: When doing the addition of the totals from the several towns in Orange County, the figures add up as 1593 + 2 misspelling votes for a total of 1595.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 2 votes as Henry L. Huntington.

sub_unit.name: Rockland
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 6 votes as Henry Y. Huntington.

sub_unit.name: Ulster
sub_unit.note: The New York American, for the Country (New York, NY) reported that Root received 2037 votes, and Huntington 1682.

sub_unit.name: Columbia
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 1 vote as H. Huntington.

sub_unit.name: Greene
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 1 vote as H. Huntington.

sub_unit.name: Rensselaer
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 2 vote as H. Huntington and 1 vote as H. Hunting.

sub_unit.name: Schenectady
sub_unit.note: Totals for Schenectady County include the returns from the town of Niskayuna, which were not counted in the Official Canvass.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: The initial reports for Franklin County only gave the returns from four towns, which were not named. Those totals were given as: Henry Huntington 324 votes, Erastus Root 290 votes. When the Official Returns were reported, it was noted that 'The votes of Dickinson and Bangor were lost.' It appears, based on the first partial reports that the votes from one or both of these towns were included in those results. In 1822 there were six towns in Franklin County.

sub_unit.name: Montgomery
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 1 vote as H. Huntington.

sub_unit.name: Hebron
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 2 vote as Huntington.

sub_unit.name: Cazenovia
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 1 vote as H. Huntington.

sub_unit.name: Oneida
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 1 vote as H. Huntington.

sub_unit.name: Chenango
sub_unit.note: Various newspapers list Erastus Root with 1703 votes. The town totals add up to 1705.
Henry Huntington received 1 vote as Henry Hunting and 1 vote as Herry Huntington.

sub_unit.name: Greene
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 1 vote as H. Huntington.

sub_unit.name: Norwich
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 6 votes as H. Huntington.

sub_unit.name: Willet
sub_unit.note: There were no votes reported for Lieutenant Governor from the town of Willet.

sub_unit.name: Otsego
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 6 votes as H. Huntington.

sub_unit.name: Tompkins
sub_unit.note: "Election: The Inspectors of elections of the town of Ithaca, have given notice, that on Monday the 4th of November next, first day of election, the poll will be opened in the forenoon, at the house of Eseck Angel, in the north-west part of the town; and will adjourn to the house of Henry Stringer, up the inlet, where it will be held in the afternoon. On Tuesday, the second day of election - forenoon at the house of John King, on the south hill, and afternoon at the house of William D. Hammond, in the east part of town. Wednesday, the third day of election, at the Hotel in this village." Republican Chronicle (Ithaca, NY). October 30, 1822.

sub_unit.name: Ithaca
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 2 votes as H. Huntington.

sub_unit.name: Manchester
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 2 votes as H. Huntington.

sub_unit.name: Palmyra
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 1 vote as Henry Huntingdon.

sub_unit.name: Sodus
sub_unit.note: The Ontario county votes include the returns from Sodus. The returns for the town of Sodus were rejected in the official canvass.

sub_unit.name: Genesee
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 1 vote as H. Huntington.

sub_unit.name: Niagara
sub_unit.note: Henry Huntington received 1 vote as H. Huntington.
